attributes.action: Hold a Parliamentary Review into the handling of the covid 19 pandemic
attributes.additional_details:
We need to understand how & why decisions were made and if they, with hindsight, would still be made again. We need a swift review to give immediate learning to help develop our governments plans moving forward.

Under normal circumstances this would wait, this is not normal & is needed now.

Please support this petition to help us all learn from the events of the last year & feed into evidenced planning for the future, by our government that serves and answers to the people, to support us all.
attributes.background: Hold an independant review to understand the decisions made due to the pandemic (PPE, lockdowns, school closures, quarantine & vaccinations) to ensure we learn lessons to improve. To ensure public confidence in the decisions made and to make best preparations for the future in light of the finding.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Launch a judge-led public inquiry into the Covid-19 pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577292

Public inquiry into UK Government spending on Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582553

Several House of Commons select committees are already looking at various aspects of the Government's response to the Covid-19 outbreak. You can find details of work being undertaken by these Committees here: https://committees.parliament.uk/inquiries/
